description: APPLICATION FOR THE PROPOSED INSTALLATION OF A NEW SEWAGE TREATMENT PLANT
decision_conditions: Condition : 1 - Commencement of development (Full Permission) - The development to which this permission relates shall be commenced not later than the expiration of 3 years from the date of this permission.

Condition : 2 - Approved Plans - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans:
Site Location Plan, DS1146P and C102 Rev T3

Condition : 3 - Materials as Specified - The facing materials to be used for the development hereby permitted shall be those specified in the application form unless otherwise agreed in writing by the Local Planning Authority.

Condition : 4 - Prior to the development of the site commencing, full details of the proposed structural impact must be provided in the form of AiP(s)/technical document(s). This must be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority and agreed with TfL Structures TAA. The details shall include but not limited to:
a.	Impact Assessment AIP(Approval in Principal)
b.	Impact Assessment Report

REASON: To safeguard structural stability of adjacent infrastructure.

Condition : 5 - Prior to the development of the site commencing, full details of the proposed construction must be provided in the form of a construction logistics plan (CLP). This must be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority and agreed with TfL. The CLP shall include details on:
a.	Details regarding parking, deliveries, and storage;
b.	Details regarding dust mitigation;
c.	Details of measures to prevent the deposit of mud and debris on the public highway; and
d.	Any other measures to mitigate the impact of construction upon the amenity of the area and the function and safety of the highway network.

No development shall commence until provision has been made to accommodate all site operatives', visitors' and construction vehicles loading, off-loading, parking and turning within the site where possible or otherwise during the construction period in accordance with the approved details.

REASON: To safeguard the free flow of traffic in the locality.

Condition : 6 - INFORMATIVE 
Please can the applicant be aware of the CLP guidance offered by TfL online at:

https://tfl.gov.uk/info-for/urban-planning-and-construction/transport-assessment-guide/freight

https://www.clocs.org.uk/resources/clp_guidance_clocs_final.pdf

Full details must be enclosed in the CLP before construction can commence however the wording of the condition can be amended as seen above.

Condition : 7 - INFORMATIVE

In relation to Condition 4, the applicant is informed that for all works Structures TAA is expecting Category 2 "Design and Check" certificate.
 
Note: The list mentioned above in Condition 4 is not conclusive and may require additional document to obtain TfL Structures Technical Approval.
 
The TfL Surface Structural Technical Approval team will require the preparation and submission of the Approval in Principal (AIP) prepared in accordance with CG300 Technical Approval of Highways
Structures DMRB standard; URL Link: here. 
 
Review cost
When the reviewing engineer and TAA have completed their review of the above mentioned document(s) in section 2, there will be an associated cost for every revision review of every document which the TfL 3rd party team must recoup from the outside party.
The mechanism in place for this is for the outside party to fill out and return the TAA-form (attached). which will then be used by the asset ops team to create an account. The Design and Check certificates and/or Assessment and Check certificates, relating to their respective and approved AiP's will not be released unless the amount stated at the end of the reviewing period has been sorted.
 
If the applicant would like direct contact with TfL Structures TAA for more clarity please contact: StructuresTechnicalApproval@tfl.gov.uk

Condition : 8 - INFORMATIVE
In accordance with paragraph 38 of the NPPF, The London Borough of Merton (LBM) takes a positive and proactive approach to development proposals focused on solutions. LBM works with applicants/agents in a positive and proactive manner by:

   i) Offering a pre-application advice and duty desk service. 
   ii) Where possible, suggesting solutions to secure a successful outcome.
   iii) As appropriate, updating applicants/agents of any issues that may arise in the processing of their application.

In this instance:

   i) The application was acceptable as submitted and no further assistance was required.
   ii) The application was approved without delay.

Condition : 9 - INFORMATIVE
The applicant is advised to consult Thames Water Utilities, Sewerage and Sewage Treatment Operations, Hogsmill Valley Works, Lower Marsh Lane, Kingston, KT1 3BW about the disposal of surface water and/or sewage from the development.
